conclusion: Distance fallen is the area under the velocity-time graph for the interval.
Velocity at t = 10 s is about 22 m/s, slightly above the 20 m/s gridline.
Velocity at t = 15 s is about 10 m/s, where the curve meets the horizontal dashed line.
Between 10 s and 15 s, the plot is a straight, sloping line, treated as a trapezoid.
Average velocity over the 5-s interval is 16 m/s.
Distance fallen is 80 m, calculated using average velocity and time interval.
80 m exceeds 75 m, so the distance is greater than 75 meters.
